ygData.subject: Re: Old Euridan and Elder Elvish learning
ygData.msgSnippet: I know that as a darkelf or Higelf you start with elder elvish. If you sit by them, I dont think you would learn any thing. But maybe if you hailed them in Old
ygData.messageBody:
I know that as a darkelf or Higelf you start with elder elvish.
If you sit by them, I dont think you would learn any thing. But maybe if you
hailed them in Old erudin they would answer you in old erudin and you would
learn :) ( this Im not sure off)

And why would it not be fair to the other in the group, ill be happy to
learn the language. :)
-----Original Message-----
From: Spehar, David J <David.Spehar@...>
To: 'eq_wizards@onelist.com' <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, May 03, 1999 4:21 PM
Subject: [eq_wizards] Old Euridan and Elder Elvish learning


>From: "Spehar, David J" <David.Spehar@...>
>
>Please tell me if there is truth to this:
>
>I want to improve my Old Euridan language skill. I plan on traveling to
>Euridan and hanging out with the NPC's there in the wizards guild. I plan
>on sitting down next to some of them. Should this improve my skill?
>
>I noticed I have Elder Elvish as a skill now (maybe because I used to hang
>out in my hometown of Felwithe allot and just picked it up) I do not want
>to spend another training point in Old Euridan or any language for that
>fact. I also do not want to have someone SPAM to me anymore unless I pay
>them to SPAM me ...and me alone (not fair to others in my group).
>
>- Ziffnab of Xegony
>
>17th Wizard

>
